New Records: Harry Brook scored his first one-day international century
Key Match Events: England clinched a 46-run win by the DLS method
Harry Brook's third-wicket stand of 156 with Will Jacks swung the momentum England's way
Liam Livingstone came in at No. 6 and immediately smashed two sixes
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted that Australia would be keen to have the final say about who is bossing the game
Australia would be equally desperate to win the ego battle
Post-Match Reflections: Harry Brook expressed relief and said it was nice to see some rewards
Mitchell Marsh admitted that Australia were a bit off the radar in this game and England totally outplayed them
Miscellaneous Highlights: England maintain their recent winning run at Lord's and are a win away from making this a near-perfect summer
The first ball should be balled at 10 am GMT, but irrespective, the series continues on Friday with the fourth ODI at Lord's
